name: Dinner Plate Aeonium
description: Aeonium tabuliforme (variegated form), commonly known as Dinner Plate Aeonium, is a succulent native to the Canary Islands, particularly Tenerife. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and features a distinctive, flat, disc-shaped rosette of fleshy, water-storing leaves (5-15 cm in diameter) arranged in a perfect circle, resembling a dinner plate. The variegated form features green leaves with cream or yellow margins. The plant displays a flat, rosette-forming growth habit. It produces small, yellow flowers on a tall spike, after which the rosette dies (monocarpic). In its native habitat, it grows in well-draining, rocky soils in coastal regions. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique interest with its distinctive flat rosette form. It's popular among succulent enthusiasts for its unusual appearance.
careTips: Allow substrate to dry between waterings
